title: Pandas: DataFrame Info
story: Understanding your DataFrame's structure is crucial. Learn to inspect shape, data types, and preview rows.
instructions: Given a DataFrame, print its shape (rows, cols) in format '(rows, cols)'. The DataFrame has 4 rows and 3 columns.
starterCode:
import pandas as pd

data = {
    'name': ['Alice', 'Bob', 'Charlie', 'David'],
    'score': [85, 92, 78, 88],
    'grade': ['B', 'A', 'C', 'B']
}
df = pd.DataFrame(data)

# Print shape
print(df.shape)
solutionHidden:
import pandas as pd

data = {
    'name': ['Alice', 'Bob', 'Charlie', 'David'],
    'score': [85, 92, 78, 88],
    'grade': ['B', 'A', 'C', 'B']
}
df = pd.DataFrame(data)
print(df.shape)

hints.text: Use df.shape to get (rows, columns) as a tuple.
